meanings.definition: To vote for more candidates than allowed in an election.
meanings.sent1: During the school election, I accidentally overvoted for two candidates instead of one.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overvote in the upcoming election to ensure your vote counts.
meanings.sent3: I didn't mean to overvote, but I got so excited about the candidates that I marked too many boxes.
meanings.sent4: Overvoting in this election is like trying to fit too many puzzle pieces into one spot.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overvoting can lead to your entire ballot being invalidated.

meanings.definition: The act of casting more votes than permitted on a ballot.
meanings.sent1: An overvote on the ballot can cause confusion and may lead to a rejected vote.
meanings.sent2: The election officials discovered an overvote on one of the ballots during the recount.
meanings.sent3: Seeing an overvote on the ballot made me realize the importance of following voting instructions.
meanings.sent4: The overvote on the ballot stood out like a bright red flag among the other votes.
meanings.sent5: The overvote was a clear indication of a mistake made by the voter.
